indicator: Payment system policy prefers interoperability between PSPs
Payment system facilitates cross-domain and/or domain-specific interoperability
Payment system has the infrastructure to facilitate (near) real-time settlement of transactions between users
Documentation for PSPs to use RTPS architecture is publicly disclosed
Technical standards/ specifications are compliant with international standards/specifications
RTPS is governed by a central bank/ financial regulator
RTPS is transparent about the rules and conditions of participation
Non bank RTPS services are subject to payment system rules
Payment system operator performance is regularly reviewed and reported on
Payment system design is informed by a multi-stakeholder group of representatives
Procedural rules for the RTPS's data handling are established
Fraudulent transactions on the RTPS are proactively prevented and managed
RTPS is subject to relevant security compliance and consumer protection laws
There exists a process to notify individuals and general public about personal data related to the RTPS data leaks or threats
Personal data linked to RTPS is protected by law
RTPS uses unique aliases to encrypt personal information
Merchants accepting retail payments are subject to security and fraud prevention compliance measures
There exist laws and institutions that individuals can seek protection under if their rights are infringed or they are discriminated against through the payment system
Data and system security standards are publicly disclosed
RTPS enables key transaction types for financial inclusion: P2P, G2P payments
Transactions are enabled through multiple access channels and non-digital means
Transaction fee for retail users is low/none
Budget for management of payment system is dedicated, reliable, sufficient
Strategy for skills training and retention (improving the interoperability and efficiency of the payment system) is established
Public entities (that are not the same as the architect of the payment system) use the payment system for G2P/P2G transactions
Private entities use the payment infrastructure to accept retail payments (P2M)
Private entities use the payment infrastructure (B2B)
